result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Alan Cox

records.addlTxt:
10:21 AM Defendant Justin Alan Cox appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Justin Alan Cox.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nelsen received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea.  Attorney Nelsen asks for a status conference in 30-45 days. State in agreement and notes an amended information was filed. Attorney Nelsen did receive amended information. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:13 AM Defendant Justin Alan Cox in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Justin Alan Cox.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Matthew Izzard- sworn and testifies. Detective with DCSD. Got report of stolen truck. Was recovered after 6 days. Defendant was seen by another officer driving stolen vehicle Had been spray painted silver and stolen plates applied. Witness identifies defendant. Defendant stated he got vehicle from another person. 
State rests, requests bind over
Att Nelsen- opposes bind over
Court finds probable cause for bind over, sets arraignment date
Arraignment scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's demand for discovery and inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
1:34 PM Defendant Justin Alan Cox appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan Reid in court making a special appearance for Justin Cox. Attorney Reid received complaint, waives reading and requests preliminary. State requests $500 cash bail and condition of no contact with SSH. State notes an fta in 2018 and defendant is on extended supervision. Attorney Reid notes local address and one fta. Asks for lower cash bail or signature bond. Court orders $500 cash bail and condition of no contact with SSH. Defendant plans to check on counsel with the public defenders office. Court reviews with defendant waiver of time limits. Defendant waives his time limits for preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver of time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
